text: Salad had no dressing. Veggies were completely bland. Chicken had little to no sauce. Beef had little to no sauce. We asked for descriptions of sushi rolls and were told they didn't have any (how does anyone know what's in the Jason Roll?!?). Unbelievably overpriced. Took way too long. Nothing on the walls to create any ambiance. Will never go back.

We came here for lunch on a Monday. The place was empty, but the staff was friendly and attentive. We had chicken and beef hibachi. The food was very reasonably priced and came out quickly. Both the chicken and the beef bowls are delicious, and very filling. The veggies are one big chunk of each carrot, broccoli, and zucchini. We will definitely return.
They have lots of sushi selections. Lunch combos and affordable and delicious especially the chicken teriyaki bowl! Nice to have cool places like this near my place.
Wow glad I stopped this place does not disappoint good size rolls I will differently be back

I love teriyaki chicken especially freshly done. They make theirs and it does have a lot but you do get what you pay for. It is pricey. The food itself was bland. The chicken was so dry and it took forever to make. There wasn't enough teriyaki to add flavor to the dish so I ended up having to make my own sauce at home and add my own seasoning to improve its dry and bland taste. I was expecting to have higher quality considering it is pricey. Guess that isn't always the case.

For the price we paid it was sub par food.  We wanted to dine in, but they have no high chairs so we ordered to go.  We got home and the sushi was bland, the beef was way over cooked and not much flavor.  We should have gone some place else for dinner.

Pros:
1.  Generous rice

Cons:
1.  Overprice
2.  Slow service
3.  Food was below average.  I ordered Yakisoba and it was bland.  The beef was overcooked I had to throw it away because it was so hard to chew.

Neutral:
1.  The place looked clean, but that's probably because it is new.  However, nothing really exciting.

Conclusion:
Not a great value.  I gave another star because atleast they were not rude.  (I did not read other people's post to ensure I gave a fair review).
Yet again Jerry Yang does not disappoint!! Awesome food here... just as good as Pocket 8's in Merced, CA!

If there were zero stars I would give them zero.  The yakisoba noodles were gross. The sushi was flavorless. There is no hibachi at this restaurant even though hibachi is in the name. Do not waste your money at this place.

My new favorite sushi restaurant!! Everything is amazing here from the salmon to the teriyaki chicken to my personal favorite the champ roll. Every meal i have had here has been amazing. The entrees are very big and definitely worth the price. Its great for dining in or a quick stop on the way home. Definitely the best sushi in southern highlands! They seem to exceed my expectations everytime i come in. On top of the great food the service is great and the employees are very welcoming!!
Awesome lunch special. The chicken bowl was a lot of food for the price. The staff was very friendly and helpful I will be visiting this place a lot and telling all my friends to come here as well.

Place was empty when my friend and I came in... The sushi was just ok... Every time I'd pick you a sushi with my chopsticks the sushi fell apart. We ended up using our fingers to hold the sushi together. We had no plates... It was pretty sucky.

This is a new place. I went to try to see if the food is good. I order the chicken beef combo, the rolls Roy roll, and the rainbow roll. I was surprise how big the rolls were. And it was very good. The chicken and beef were cook perfect and not dry. Very good flavor on the meet. Over all I would say the food is very good. I have been to Yama sushi, oyshi, sushi on rainbow, Maui rose, Hamada of Japan, Osaka. Dynamite's food is just as good. Keep in mind that this is a little express take out, so I order to go. But I think the food is very good. Ying Mark L.

After waiting over 35 minutes for sushi and noodles I was very disappointed to be given top Ramen.  The dish I ordered looked nothing like what was pictured. The dish pictured had thick chow mein  noodles.  what I received was the skinny wavy top Ramen. The spices where also very pungent and over the top. Very disappointed to pay $15.95 for $.25 noodles.

This is the best place to eat in Southern Highlands. My fiancé and I go here at least 2 times a week. Great value for the price. Hibachi is wonderful and sushi is very well done. We get the Philly roll and Champ roll every time we go. Try this place, you'll come back.

Short story: Too expensive for what you get. 

  My boyfriend and I were really excited for this place to open, specially since the place across the street has gone down hill since changing owners. 

Biggest problem is the prices. I have no problem paying for good sushi, but when your charging the same or more than a sit down restaurant that has 3 times your over-headed there is an issue.  I expected fair priced good (not great) fast sushi.  

Ordered three rolls, 2/3 were good. One was good enough to order again, I would tell you what it was but they gave it to us by mistake so I'm not sure.  We will probably go back but no rush when we can order sushi mon to go right after the gym and just pick it up before heading home to Southern Highlands.

The service was great, the food was excellent! My favorite is the Jerry Special Roll. The sashimi's were very large portions and fresh. The Poki Poki was excellent! I would definitely go back! See you soon Jerry - thanks for making us feel like "family".

I stopped by Dynamite Grill yesterday as I had a sushi craving and not much time. I was impressed and sorry I hadn't tried them sooner. I ordered the Dynamite Roll and Champ Roll. The portions were very large and the food fresh. I like spicy so the chef kicked it  up a notch for me. It was yummy! I couldn't finish both rolls but it was tasty trying.

I'd love to try this place...however I couldn't! 

I got off of work and wanted to grab a bite to eat around 8:15 and at 8:15 the doors were locked! 

I find this kind of odd seeing as their advertised time on Yelp is 9:00 and they also have a large banner posted outside their store saying they're open until 10:00.

Kind of odd right?

*Edit* I have called multiple times at 12:03pm over an hour after they open to place a pickup order but it doesn't seem they are open yet. 

so what the heck are your hours Dynamite Grill?

Just left after having "lunch". Walk in, there is a putrid smell of sewer all over the restaurant. We were waiting on a prescription to be filled at Walgreens across the street, so options were limited. 

Guy taking the order acted like he was really put out that we were there. Bf and i ordered 3 items total: vegetable tempura, one avocado roll with cream cheese, and a chicken/beef lunch "special". $32.00. Seriously? 

While waiting i used the restroom which had an even WORSE sewer smell. Food arrived. Immediately a fruit fly flew into my soy sauce. Bf's lunch special was huge, mainly more salad than meat. My avocado roll consisted of 5 slices, so big in circumference that it couldn't be eaten in one bite, so the thing falls apart with each bite. Barely any rice, tons of avocado, and a speck of cream cheese. Veggie tempura barely had any breading, and veggies were still crunchy. Not at all cooked. 

Only one other table in the place, when they left, the same employee let the table sit dirty at least until we left. Needed a box and had to retrieve him from the back of the place where he was sitting at a table and ask him for one. His parting words were: "just leave the stuff on the table". Not coming back.
I really enjoyed the food. Happy to have a new option in the neighborhood.  The menu could use some work but the staff was helpful, so it's not much of an issue.
I had the shrimp and it was really good, the flavor and the special sauce, to die for! Excellent service and very friendly staff. I would recommend to everybody :)
Lunch special was awesome and large portion of food for the price and came with a drink. The owners where so nice. It's defiantly worth checking this place out
Probably the best semi fast food join in the neighborhood. Teriyaki chicken and poke salad was delicious.

My wife and I decided to try this place. We live in SoHi, and she read a few good things on Yelp about it. Walked in at 5:30pm. No one else in the whole place. I ordered a poke bowl, she ordered a combo plate. When she asked to sub fried rice, she was told she had to order an entire separate fried rice plate. No substitutions. I offered to pay an up charge, and the man who took our order repeated that we had to buy an entire fried rice plate in order to get fried rice. Fine, whatever. The man who took our order was the one who cooked our food. I never saw another employee. Which might explain why it took 27min for him to prepare or meal, in spite of the phase "Sushi Express" plastered all over the walls. The steak shrimp combo was over cooked, both the steak and the shrimp were like rubber. He did ask my wife how she wanted her teriyaki steak cooked, to which she replied "Medium". It wasn't. It was more like chewing the sole of a Nike. It's called Dynamite Grill, so I expected my poke salad to be spicy. It had so much chili sauce on it, that it burned my eyes before I ever took a bite. I choked down 7 or 8 pieces before I had to surrender to the flames. Maybe someone who reads this will be excited by that level of spice; but I prefer to be able to taste the dish, and have the spice be a compliment. Neither of us finished our meals, neither of us wanted to. We won't be back.
Great service.  Friendly staff. Large portions. The jerry roll is awesome. The fried rice is great too. A great addition to southern highlands

My new favorite lunch stop. The Rainbow roll was delicious! So fresh and filling. Huge roll by the way. Larger and tastier than most sushi restaurants in town. The staff offered me some miso soup w my order. Perfect combo. Great food and friendly service. Love this place!

I really wish I would have read the reviews prior to coming to this place. I've been driving past it for months and with Hibachi food being my favorite, I was hoping this place was good! 

Unfortunately, this place has not good at all. It started with it taking 19 minutes for my take out order to be prepared. I understand it's being made fresh, but with no other customers inside, this was a bit long. And to top off the wait, it was extremely hot inside the place! 

The food: I ordered the chicken/steak meal, shrimp meal, fried rice, and order of gyoza. The chicken and gyoza were actually good (reason for 2 stars and not 1 star). The sauce with the gyoza was great!! The shrimp was ok, nothing special. Now to the bad items - the steak!! The steak was so rough and disgusting I actually cut it up and fed it to my steaks. I haven't had such rough and chewy steak in years. The fried rice was a very large portion for the price, but it contained corn and bacon!!! WTF?? Seriously WTF!!! Corn in rice is Mexican. And who the hell has ever put bacon in fried rice? I love bacon, but it didn't go good together. 

Lastly, I would like to say the younger gentleman working (don't know his name) was extremely friendly and showed a passion for the job. When handing me the order he asked me some questions to verify everything was correct with the order. Very nice guy! 

Hopefully this place figures it out cause they have potential with the great idea. I may come back in a few months to give it a try again.

I saw this place while getting gas next door.  I had the craving for sushi without the appetite worthy of an all you can eat outing.  I picked up a spicy tuna roll and was very pleasantly surprised.  The roll was on par with your standard all you can eat places (sushimon, oyshi, etc).   I'll be using this place to cure my random sushi cravings when my appetite doesn't call for an AYCE experience.
Can we say Wow!! This place was awesome and very filling, we loved it.  Yes, the prices are high but worth every penny.  The Roberts family highly recommends this place!

I was really hoping this would be good I guess I have the same complaint as everyone else, definitely overpriced and the food wasn't good. I've never had fried rice with corn, bacon and undercooked ham. It had too much pepper and it was really mushy. I ordered the pokey pokey salad and when I asked the girl at the register what it was she said "a regular salad" and then I said "Really for $14.99?" and she said "oh yeah never mind" and had to cook explain it it. It was too spicy the lettuce was old, and he forgot to add dressing. I will never eat there again.

I'm from Central Cal so I'm always about real and fresh food.  My company brought us to Vegas for training and I did not want eat at the expensive restaurants at the hotel.  A buddy of mine suggest we venture out.  We found this place and gave it a shot.  First impression was this place is tiny.  Is it fast food only?  ugh... Whatever, we're here already.  Staff was real cool.  They all greeted us.  I asked the cashier what they were known for and she said most people get the grilled salmon plate or noodles.  Don't remember what the name of the noodles were but I got the salmon and my buddy got the noodles.  Prices were fair.  When we got our food, I was impressed.  Rice, salmon, and salad... real food... yeeeeaahhh!  My goodness the salmon was absolutely bomb; bomb as in freakin good.  Salad dressing was so good too that I had to ask what is was.  The chief simply said "it's house dressing", which means none of yo business, just eat it lol.  I had a taste of the noodles too and it was superb.  Full of flavors.  You can never tell how the food is going to be like when going to these places but wow oh wow.  My buddy and I went back the next day.  He got noodles and I got salmon again lol.  Real good stuff.  Must go back.  I dare you to try it.

YUM! This place is great for very quick and amazing quality food. The atmosphere is pretty quiet and laid back and the place itself is run well - very professional, friendly, helpful, clean, etc. 

Jerry Yang (the owner/2007 main event winner) came out and greeted us. He was so friendly and you can tell that he really cares about the place and customer satisfaction. Also, the young cashier that rang us up (wish I remembered name) was super helpful and just went above and beyond. -thanks to everyone there that made this such a great experience!

We tried the chicken katsu, combination fried rice, and the dynamite roll-- all amazing.. I'm sure everything else on the menu is amazing too :)

Come check this place out!!
Same issues. EXPENSIVE!!!!  Spicy tuna roll was ok, not bad at all. BEEF yakisoba was the worst I've ever had. Just not good at all.

Tried this place for the second time last night just in case the first was a just opened gota work the bugs out fluke but it wasn't!  Ive gota say thats the Worst rice ive ever attempted to eat! C'Mon man ur supposed to be a sushi joint... If yall can't do rice any better then that it'll be a short lived venture into the restaurant business!  Was like trying to eat a softball of mush. Rice isnt suppose to be stuck together like paste and be slimy. Hell i can do much better with this $40 rice steamer i got and my complete and utter lack of culinary skills. Now i dont know if its just very cheap rice or very low quality craftsmanship but lemme just say im definitely not a picky eater but this place even though close to my house will never get a third try from me... Absolutly terrible excuse for Rice SMH!

The food is good on par with more expensive sit down Habachi places. The portions are great. It is relatively healthy compared to other Asian cuisine options in Southern Highlands, and the staff is friendly too. I'm a regular at this place and I am pretty picky when it comes to restaurants.

The Jerry Special roll was absolutely amazing. Flavorful. I always love when my sushi rolls are big and not small. They were big and it is worth what your actually paying for. The staff was so friendly as well!

Amazing service, the counter guy helped me alter my order to save more money which i think is so helpful and considerate. The food is always fresh and cooked perfectly. I have no idea why it isnt more popular i am a huge foodie and this is better than most Asian restaurants in the strip.

I had it to go and it done quickly. I just didn't expect SOOOO much rice on my sushi and was definitely NOT what I expected. Food was okay; nothing amazed me. There's other sushi places in this location and it's serious competition. I'd say to maybe check out the food for yourself, but don't have high expectations and don't compare it to other sushi places down the street.
Bad sushi. Take a drive down Silverado ranch to Maryland parkway and go to Sushimon instead.

"DAMN, THAT'S SOME GO~OD SUSHI & BEEF TERIYAKI!" 

When I bit into the freshly grilled beef from the Teriyaki Beef and Shrimp combo, the flavor and juice coming out of it was just what I needed from a hot day from the Strip. And the tenderness of the beef was something to be remembered. Kudos for the proportions~ You can't get a portion like that at that price at any other sushi place~ 

Anyone who know what Laarb is should definitely try the Poki Poki, under the salad section. It's definitely worth it in my book~

And lastly, the Jerry Special Roll... Just Order It! I'm still craving for it today!

I've been here 3 or 4 times now and I feel can make a fair judgement.  They have stepped it up since they opened. The entrees come with salad, veggies and rice. The portion was easily 2 meals and everything was fresh. The Salmon Teriyaki is good, but find it inconsistent depending on who is cooking. Chicken & Beef Teriyaki also good.  Veg is that perfect spot between still crisp yet soft. I love simple, good, fresh food and that's what you get.  They also added a $5.95 lunch special.  The cook and cashier was very nice.

I have been so excited for this place to open. We love Japanese food, hibachi, and sushi! I had high expectations for this place because I was imagining it to be like Volcano Grill (Yelp it, so worthy). I know this was only their 2nd day open, and I'm hoping they work out their kinks because the location is so convenient for us. I hope they start with the entreé pricing because is super ASSpensive.

I wouldn't mind paying the $90 we did for our meal if the quality was up to par. I understand it's labeled "sushi express", but what's up with the dine-in-hibachi-where-the-chef-puts-on-a-fancy-show-for-you-cook-in-front-of-you prices????? Seriously! $12 average for a Hibachi Entreé with STEAMED rice, $3 extra for fried rice. You also get steamed veggies. I mean, this is a fast food style restaurant! They serve their food in styrofoam for dine in. That's cool and all, but the price to quality has no balance.

What we ordered:
-Vegas Roll
The closest to what is normally called a Tiger roll elsewhere. Shrimp tempura roll with spicy tuna. Their Tiger roll here is not like this. This was our first time eating sushi from a styrofoam plate lol. But I gotta give it up, this was bomb and we'd come back for this AND only this!!
-Shrimp Tempura
They don't have TEMPURA SAUCE!!!! I know it's a new restaurant but the poor girl at the register gave us a look like we were making shit up when we asked, "do you have tempura sauce?" She looked so confused and said all they had were sriracha, soy sauce and other sauces in the back for sushi. Wtf????
-Salmon Teriyaki Entreé 
My 4 year old finished his fish and he said it was good. 
-Beef Entreé + $3 fried rice
This was my husband's. He said his was good but nothing he'd come back for. He's a sauce guy and he's appalled as to why no sauces were offered or served. Hibachi and sauces go together!!
-Shrimp Entreé + $3 fried rice
Look for the photo I uploaded! My shrimp and rice looked charry. Like they didn't clean the grill well before cooking my meal. What if it gets busier than it was tonight guys? Fried rice should be part of the entreés!!
-Chicken Katsu Entreé + $3 fried rice 
My son, who loves chicken Katsu, from almost anywhere was sort of upset because they poured the sauce over the meat. He ended up eating it all anyway because he was hungry after a basketball game. He's a big fan of Hibachi fried rice and he said this one tasted weird. Probably charry tasting like mine did.

Next time we want Hibachi again, we're going down the street to Ohjah. We'd be paying the same price plus salad, miso, and SAUCES!! Oh and we'd get a free show from the cooks too. Next time we want "express" style food like this, we'll take the drive to Volcano Grill. At least their meals come with fried rice and everything tastes delicious. 

Southern Highlands is a family oriented neighborhood, you need more tables that are family friendly. Not everyone coming in will come in twos. High chairs needed as well. Staff needs more Japanese food education. Girl at register kept asking the cooks what stuff were lol. I almost feel bad for asking for Tempura sauce, meat sauce, what's in their rolls, etc.
The most amazing sushi in town.  Great services, fresh fish very clean.  Jerry you've done it again my experience was outstanding.  Can't wait for dinner tonight..

Came to try and support my local Southern Highlands new restaurant. Very disappointed, I've been to many Japanese restaurants and I know how expensive they are. But this place is way overpriced for the lack of quality of the food they serve. Their sushi is very dry, the rice is nutty and the overall presentation is poor. Same with their rice plate, again the rice is nutty, the meat are hard to chew and flavorless and the overall quality is also poor.

On the other hand, the service is great and the people are friendly. So maybe there's still a chance for this place.

I honestly like it here. 

So I just picked up my to go order and it's really good! The price is understandable because of its location and the fact that it's a small business. The food quality is worth the price; the portions are big on the combo meals. Their chicken katsu, teriyaki chicken and steak are perfectly cooked and well seasoned. I really like their salad dressing too; it's light with a kick of garlic. The staff is polite and friendly. I will defiantly come back.

Very amazing experience, friendly and knowledgeable staff.  Egg rolls were excellent, remind me of the kind I used to get in Chicago's Chinatown. Ordered the Beef & Shrimp Combo, it was delicious, everything was fresh and the presentation was very nice with good portion sizes. Highly Recommended, plan on going back next time I'm in Las Vegas.

New spot on my side of town decided why not let me try it out..

Well coming into the restaurant few days after they open and it does not look like it's ready for opening. Decor and restaurant still looks a little bare. No music or anything on so conversations are a little awkward to have when everyone can hear.. Restaurant not ready for opening. On top of that owners not here one of the main reasons smaller restaurants like this fail. Still decided to try the food.

So I go in and look at the menu restaurant style is teriyaki madness-ish. Prices are restaurant range. Beef shrimp combo 16$ for a pretty small portion. Twice the price for half the food at Panda Express or teriyaki madness which are the closest comparable restaurants. Two entrees and two drinks 40$. 

Still I don't like to write negative reviews and wasn't going to if it weren't for the lack of service and wait time. I then decided to politely return a meal I took a bite out of since it completely tasted like pepper (beef yakisoba) and had to wait 25 minutes to try and return it. A lot of people waiting long wait times for orders.


Wouldn't go back. I always try to find the good in places and be as optimistic as possible but this restaurant just didn't do it for me.

The kids working there and the girl taking our order were sweet and tried but we're just inexperienced not there fault .

Below average food. Restaurant is not ready to be opened. Slow service. Don't worry you're not missing anything by not stopping here. Who knows maybe they get better and improve in the future..
The employees are great and the food is amazing. Highly recommended the shrimp entree and edamame.

Suuuuuper disappointing! I thought I give this place a try and not listen to the reviews. Boy was I wrong! Prices are way to expensive and portions are super small. Guys come on! I'm going to have to stick with China go go.
Really like their spicy tuna roll and crunchy roll. Big portion for the main dishes. Server were friendly and welcoming.

Me and my wife have been going here since it opened and have had nothing but good service and good food untill tonight.  We ordered the same rolls we allways get cruch roll and  champ roll. When we got home we had our crunch roll but there was a different roll with it no big deal we call the restaurant only to be told there must have been a miscommunication and they would not do anything about it unless we wanted to order a new roll. which would not be happening at $12 per roll, see i am 100% sure we ordered the right thing simply because we dont know even the names of any of the other rolls. they should have honored the mistake they made and replaced the roll. we will not be going back.

I have to say I really like this place. My boyfriend got me and my Mom hooked on the Chicken Yakisoba with a side of their "dynamite sauce", just delicious and the right amount of spicy! Today we tried out their Vegetable & Shrimp Tempura as well as a Rainbow Sushi Roll. Their tempura batter is on point, actually much more flavorful than a lot of sushi restaurants! I also loved the sauce it came with which was a blend of dynamite sauce and a sort of sweet teriyaki blend, just delish and a great compliment to the tempura mix! I will most definitely order it again! The rainbow roll was pretty good, generous amount of fish which was very fresh. I still prefer Kazuki Sushi, but for a quick fix this most definitely satisfies the craving! The cook really took his time prepping our "to go" meal, which honestly I didn't mind at all, I actually really appreciate that level of patience, pride and service that was taken to ensure a good experience. If you're going to be pressed for time definitely call and order ahead. I will definitely be returning, the only reason I didn't give 5 stars is due to the price point although with the quality of food and service, I can overlook the price once in awhile!

Okay so this one is so hard for me because I wanted to love this place so much, as southern highlands kind of has limited selection. 

First of all I misunderstood, I thought this was a real sit down hibachi, so maybe that's where my disappointment began but at the same time I was excited to have my food to go to go eat in front of a TV lol. 

I ordered 2 chicken teriyaki meals. He wouldn't allow me to have them served with fried rice, why? I don't know. So I ordered the side of fried rice, an additional $10. The chicken, was horrible, poor quality meat. The seasoning itself was fine, but the cuts of the chicken were very chewy, and stringy, if that makes sense. 
The fried rice was horrendous, I'm sorry. There was pork bits that ruined the entire taste of the rice. I am not totally against pork but the way they cooked this with the rice was just down right gross. 
I will say the side salad that comes with the teriyaki meals was great. The vegetables were again just gross. No wear near what I typically find at a hibachi place. (Ohjah) 

I ordered a teriyaki salmon meal as well, and I wish I could give you a review on it, as they forgot to cook this and send it out with the rest of my order. 

I ordered a crunchy roll and a Vegas roll, the crunchy roll was worth the price and pretty good. The Vegas simply had so much on top it was over bearing, but I won't say it was bad as I am not a sushi expert. 

So for 3 teriyaki meals, and 2 orders of sushi my total came to $74 and some change. $74??????? I was so caught off guard when he told me this but of course I paid in hopes I would really enjoy this meal. Sadly I got home and discovered I didn't receive my salmon, which I will say to their credit they told me I could come back and grab or whenever I wanted. But I think if a customer is paying 80 bucks (more or less) for a few things, maybe we should check and make sure they receive their meals. Clearly I was very disappointed with this place and won't be returning, even for the salmon. The place was clean and the man himself was cool, not rude or anything. But man was I sad when I ate the food. 

I see some people really enjoy this place so maybe this was just a fluke for me, but I feel for the price I can go to Ohjah or even China Gogo and get much better tasting food.

Oh my! This place is the best! Before Dynamite Grill opened, I had been pretty limited to the Kazuki Sushi across the street. And that place was just okay. Not my favorite. But boy am I glad Dynamite Grill opened up! 

My first impression coming in was, "wow, it's so clean, bright, and organized." Often times, I go to sushi restaurants and I can barely read the menu because it's so dark. The people who own this restaurant are just the sweetest people I've ever met. They're so gracious and they make you feel like they're happy to have you in their restaurant. 

At first, I expected the small sized sushi that I usually would see at the other sushi restaurant I used to go to. But when I opened up my to go box at home, I was so surprised by how big the size was of my rolls. I ordered the Jerry's Special, Caterpillar Roll, and the Crunch Roll. Usually, I order at least 4 rolls and eat it all at other sushi restaurants. I couldn't even get through 2 rolls! Everything is so fresh and flavorful. It's definitely my new favorite place to go for sushi!
Excellent food & service. Huge portions and great value. Kids and adults enjoyed the meal. Highly recommended!!!!

This place was unbelievable the service was superb. The girl at the front was so sweet and so helpful. The food is amazing! I ordered a crunchy roll and wow was awesome we also ordered the fried rice and it was seriously the absolute best fried rice ice ever had! Portions are big so come hungry lol prices are perfect you get so much food your your buck! The owner jerry yang is so hospitable and so caring he truly cares about his customers and his restaurant. I HIGHLY recommend this restaurant to anyone on the Las Vegas area. Next time I come back I'll be back for sure! Thank you for such a great dinner and great customer service A++!!!!

Staff was friendly. Got the salmon teriyaki entree..wasn't worth it imo. I'd probably go somewhere else if you're looking for a bento box type. As for the rolls. The champ roll....SO GOOD..I'm def coming back for the rolls. The seaweed salad was good, & the gyoza. Gyoza was served with dynamite sauce...and it tasted so fucking amazing I dipped my sushi in it. The miso was not for me, unless you like it dark and salty (that's what she said). There's a couple things I wouldn't get, but I'm most likely gonna be a repeat customer cause I can't get away from the sauce and the rolls.

Don't waste your money this place is overpriced and the food is disgusting! My husband got the chicken katsu it was fried in old fry oil and smelled so bad that my kitchen stunk like old fry or oil rest of the night. The noodles were soggy and looks like top ramen, but top Ramen is like $.10 and taste better than this place. Definitely won't recommend the sushi, the one across the street better. I usually don't waste my time writing reviews but this place is a definite no-no! Gross!!!!
Finally checked out the Dynamite Grill, tried several of there rolls, the spicy crab and California rolls were very good, and the tempura was perfect, not bad for a neighborhood  food joint.

I hate giving bad reviews, so I'm going to hold my opinion until I try this place again in a couple (weeks? months?) however long it takes them to really be ready to open. 

I love supporting locals business whenever possible but it's just too soon for this business. Rolls are expensive, veggie tempura pricey and raw! Menu has no description of rolls, so I had to ask the chef to explain. And styrofoam plates, boxes and cups made it all feel even cheaper... Plus toxic for the environment.
Great food. Fast service. Friendly staff loved the food. Dynamite was delicious. Poki was spicy but good

I went in to try their teriyaki bowls. I ordered a chicken bowl with all white meat. I got thigh meat. The gyoza were pretty decent. The place was clean,  but better food can be found elsewhere. Very average. Samurai Sam's does the fast-food teriyaki thing much better.

Horrible, won't be returning.  The outside media leads you to believe that this is a decent sushi place but don't be fooled.  The fish is not fresh tasting the sushi is sloppy and not well done in any sense of the word, the rice was not even sushi rice.  The prices they charge are the same as premium sushi restaurants.  Do not waste your money here, just go to your favorite sushi place, you will thank me.

Overpriced, bland, chicken Katsu doesn't come with dipping sauce. Thats .75 cents extra. You can't get fried rice as a side, thats a seperate made entree. If you're die hard asian, you might like it regardless. To the rest of the world..its below average and expensive.

Hmm where to start. I was driving back from school today and at the corner of my eye I saw DYNAMITE SUSHI! Instantly the thought had my mouth salivating! So later on that day I pay this place a visit! Walk in to large images of Japanese decor and tables lined along the side of the restaurant. I stare at the menu for a bit and finally landed on Chicken Katsu and a FRESH roll of yellowtail sushi! It took a little while for the food to arrive but it was very bearable so I didn't mind! The sushi came out first and the yellowtail in the sushi was very generous! I was however expecting an 8 piece roll but only got 6 pieces 3.5 stars on the roll, the chicken Katsu was flavorful but what I really enjoyed was the salad dressing! It was thick and creamy mmm yummy! Overall experience was a 3 out of 5! Pricing was a tad bit over in my opinion, but good food.

I have to agree with Many, the outside does not match the inside.  Very bland and not very exciting.  I went on a week day and it looked like maybe the owner was inside.  No customer service.  Very basic.  Super expensive! I could have went to another actual restaurant down the street and paid the same price for chicken terryaki and received better service. I will try again in a few months (if it's still there)

I wish there was a 0 star option. That's how bad the food is over there. I ordered 3 Salmon rolls which totaled up to $26 (same price as an all you can eat at other places). The 3 rolls had about 14 pieces total which was almost all rice and the salmon in there was really chewy because it still had the black stuff on the bottom of it. I ate 3 pieces and was about to throw up. I would advise anyone craving sushi to get it from some where else because this place is just horrid and expensive. This is my first yelp review and I had to post this just to let people know that dynamite grill is NOT the spot.

I have the same issues as everyone mentioned here. Menu needs description, and seriously over price! There is a sushi restaurant literally a block from here and for $26 you get an all you can eat fair, and it's actually really good. My husband ate here twice, and we ordered and same sushi, it wasn't consistent. 

I think they need to stop serving in paper plates. Step up just a little more. My husband ordered the udon soup and they served it on a drink cup! Also, staff needs to learn the menu. As a new restaurant expect everyone to ask questions (especially when there aren't any description on the menu), so  educate your staff! The girl couldn't even pronounce udon correctly... Scary!

Also I had the combination fried rice, totally burnt, AND the food was so slow to come out. I don't think they expedite the food well. Seems like they cook the food one at a time, but rush it because it was burnt ( weird right?) 

I am really rooting for them, and hoping they are reading everyone's review to make the change. They have great potential, but they need major change. 

Good luck!

This is still our favorite place I absolutely love it! The fish is so fresh and not tough at all. The portions are great and they are so fast. 

The restaurant is always clean and fresh feeling.

I love sushi and eat at lot of different restaurants and this is by far my favorite.

This picture is of a roll my fiancé got me for take out.

The staff is friendly and I will continue to go here!

After trying all the dishes and going on different times of the day, including the service and prices, I'd say this place is a decent place to eat.  It's in a good location!  I think some of the rolls were unique, and the employees were all friendly.  Check it out sometime :)

We were in Vegas & craving sushi.  We had dinner here & it was really awesome.  The Poke was so fresh & it had an incredible, spicy sauce that was perfect.  My friend had tempura vegetables & the dynamite roll. She loved it.  The hospitality was warm & they even brought out a yummy specialty roll.  Definitely need to visit when you're in Vegas.

We have tried this place a few times now. The food is good but a bit pricy. We don't really care about the ambience because we get our food to go. We have updated our rating to four stars because the food has been consistently good each time we have gone. If you are willing to pay up over China a go go you will get better than China a go go.

I drove from the northeast side to the southwest side of Las Vegas, because a client had recommended this place for its great Teppanyaki style and sushi. I have never been crazy about Teppanyaki from a restaurant - being Japanese American - I was raised on Okinawan cuisine - country style - my mom was a cook and makes great Japanese food. So I am picky with I eat out. 

I'm glad he recommended this place- I was skeptical at first, but loved the Dynamite Sushi roll and Rolls Royce Sushi Roll.  I also had the teriyaki chicken, beef and grilled shrimp. Well seasoned dish with a side salad with a house salad dressing. The Dynamite roll had a spicy sauce - not too spicy. I will definitely recommend this to my friends and family.  I saw that they just added a lunch special - I will have to swing around there again.  It was worth the drive for me. 

The customer service was on point , friendly and made the dining experience excellent. I wish there was one on my side of town

Sorry! I know my foods and this was not good. Steak was way over cooked to where it was tough.  Shrimp slightly over cooked too. Told the girl up front and she didn't seem to want to correct this error or even tell the cook as I waited a few mins after she took my place away.  Just moved to this area and was excited to check this place out... Won't stray away from Volcano Grill again!

It's a small simple little restaurant with high tables along the side that sits two people per table. I got the teriyaki salmon while my friend got the chicken katsu and yellowtail sushi. The teriyaki salmon was good. It had an underlying garlic butter and had enough teriyaki sauce to give it the sweet taste. The salad dressing was pretty good as well. The chicken katsu, on the other hand, was just average. There's nothing special that struck me. My teriyaki salmon was about $13 which was somewhat reasonable since salmons are expensive. The chicken katsu, however, was about $11 which I thought was a little too much considering half of the plate just consist of a salad. The sushi they had were also more expensive than the good sushi restaurants I go to.

I am not sure how long this place has been here, from the looks of it, not long. I went in about 6:45 on a Wednesday.   I don't eat meat, and the only thing veggie seemed to be a " veggie roll" in the sushi menu. I asked if they could make veggie hibachi (I'm thinking this is easy , reasonable request) The girl at register looked at me kinda funny, turned to ask cook if this madness was even possible. He said sure, he would throw in some tofu. Cool.  I am not even lying when I say I waited 20 minutes.  I finally went up to the counter to ask what's up. The girl said " oh, here it is, sorry" god knows how long it was there. Had my back to the counter, my mistake. I paid 10.00 for some mediocre food. Hopefully they will check the prices and maybe run a special or something.. And don't be afraid to throw a couple vegetarian items on the menu.

So I went here to pick up to go and I ordered miso soup,chicken teriyaki bowl and a seaweed salad. Food is overpriced. There's no description for their menu and nothing special with the place. I wasn't going to have a problem until this guy who is getting my food ready literally used his bare hands to pick up the seaweed salad to transfer it to my to go container. IT WAS DISGUSTING! He even did it in front of me. After that he started touching everything even the trash can! The only good thing is that the other guy cooking my chicken teriyaki is wearing plastic gloves. I'm not coming back here.

Where to begin...??? What is this place??
I was so excited when I first saw this establishment under construction and could not wait for it to open. But boy...what a tremendous disappointment!!! I am a Southern Highlands resident & dinning options are very limited in these neck of the woods!!

First the decor:
As bland & as plain as vanilla gets, without a hint of ambiance!!! It was like an uncomfortable "hospital" like environment. I could only imagine what Joe Bastianich & Tim Love would say if this were an episode of Restaurant Start Up!! Plain walls, no music, no...style!! The place felt like they ran out of money and they drastically cut corners to make do with what they had. If it weren't for the signs, I would have no clue this was a Japanese restaurant!! 

Prices: Overpriced for what you get!! 
I ordered the teriyaki chicken n beef entree. I paid about $16 dollars & I felt cheated for the amount of food I received! I don't mind paying for food, but give me my money's worth!!  There were pieces of fat blubber on my beef and hardly any chicken!! The food was not bad...but I have had better. I was not "impressed". It was just...ok.

2 Stars:
The wait was not too bad for my order to come out. About 10 minutes. I ordered to go. The young girl at the counter was very sweet & nice. Great customer service.

Bottom line: Save your money & go elsewhere. Champagne prices for a beer quality restaurant with a plain vanilla ambiance!!

Ate here for the first time yesterday.  The staff was super friendly by the place was completely empty. 
Tried the Katsu and was surprised that they didn't use a panko breading.  The end result was a heavier katsu that wasn't terrible but wasn't as expected either.   The katsu sauce was not good. ...threw it out.  Let's talk about price!  My husband had the katsu plate, I had the katsu bowl and we shared 1 sushi roll. .. $32!!!!  Way over priced...way.
Also had the crunchy roll and it was yummy!  Will return to try other menu items but won't have the katsu again until they fix their recipe.
Delicious Japanese Teriyaki place in the neighborhood.Excellent food and nice people in there and great prices

At first, from the outside.. we thought it was a restaurant. But it's more of a Japanese fast food. 
Staff are nice but the food is VERY MEDIOCRE.
My husband is a fan, spicy tuna roll is good

First time at this place family of four with two small kids. We ordered the fried rice dynamite roll spicy crab roll and a tuna roll. The bill was $51. The food was made fresh the sushi was fresh everything was delicious.
Styrofoam plates,  overly priced below medeocor food.  If they don't change, they won't last.

Took my food to go.   Interior feels like a fast food place and small.   

Price I think was a little too much especially comparing to Ohjah just less than 5 minutes away that is a sit down,  tepenyaki style,  cooked in front of you restaurant.   My kids an i enjoy Ohjah but there are times I'd rather have it to go. 

Taste:  eh,  ok, but not for the price.

Too expensive for express sushi. I would get some ideas from spicy tuna or sushi loca and then charge that much. Hope these reviews make a difference and we will see some changes in the future. Staff and chef were really helpful and personable. Wish them the best. In general, Southern highlands lacks nice places to eat at...

A little disappointing... Was so excited to have something like this open up in the neighborhood. 

I ordered (3) things: Tiger roll, seaweed salad and miso soup. The Tiger roll was bland and missing flavor. The miso soup was not miso soup and was quite flavorless. The seaweed salad was normal, however the amount given was way more than necessary. It did reflect in the price as well. 

I did not appreciate that the menu did not have a description of what was in some of their specialty rolls. 

Overall, it was overpriced, bland and unexciting. I may consider trying them again in a few months to see if there is any improvement.

This is not your ordinary Sushi place. 
The sushi is made for you by World Series of Poker Champion Jerry Yang.
He turns out to be one of  the most friendly and talented guys i have met. 
The atmosphere is easy, comfortable neighborhood casual.
Pricing is almost fast food range but the quality of this Sushi is unmatched.
Seriously, some of the best sushi i have had. 
It was delicious, fresh, and very high quality.
I have been to a lot of Sushi places and the Dynamite grill is now on top of the list. 
I had the Rolls Royce Roll, the Spicy Tuna, and the Jerry Roll. My party shared rice and Teriyaki Chicken and it was almost too big of a portion.
The Tuna roll was delicious, but could have been rolled a little tighter. All rolls were served with a plate of wasabi and a mountain of ginger which i love to put on each piece of Sushi.
This is well worth the 10 minute drive from the Vegas Strip, and worth every penny for exceptionally good Sushi, made by the owner.
Great food. Great price. I will come back again and again. 

Lance Williams

The name Dynamite had me stop in with my daughter to grab some lunch, we are all about a mixture of cultures and food, and we both love teriyaki and rice. The minute we got there, and open the door they were so attentive polite very clean. Me and my daughter ordered two combo plates that were to die for :) yes you got it. They Rocked it. Overwhelming with the food quality and service. its my new number #1 place in Vegas.so fresh and cooked to order. I had to order eggs rolls to go so I could take some more food home with me lol. If you are in Vegas and get a chance to stop in you will be absolutlty greatful you did :) Enjoy!

I wouldn't complain too much about the food.  I enjoyed the spicy crab sushi roll and I would come back for the food if they changed everything else.  

Prices.
First, they use paper plates, which I'm fine with, but $16 bucks for chicken teriyaki/shrimp combo? Only after I got my food, I found out you can change your rice to fried rice for an additional $3??.  Umm $19 for a combo plate ... ouch ! you gotta step your game up.  The portions are too small.  Use real plates instead of paper or serve it to us restaurant style because I doubt this family orientated neighborhood is going to pay over $20 bucks for 1 person to eat.  Let me get my money's worth.

Variety of Food:
The name "sushi express", you're thinking a variety of sushi but there is not much on the menu.  Also no descriptions on any of the rolls so you would need to ask them what is in it.  Maybe a suggestion would be adding bento boxes or lunch specials so people can have a combo of hibachi and sushi instead of paying full price if I want both.   

Atmosphere:
Seating is limited so if you have a large group stay away.  No music, no decorations so you can hear everything and everyone. 

I hope they change some things up because I love seeing new places succeed !!! I know our neighborhood was excited about something like this opening.   For now, if you want a chicken teriyaki bowl I would go down the street to teriyaki madness for 7 bucks and if you want your sushi fix, go to your favorite sushi restaurant because you'll be paying the same price!

Hmmm I will start with the interior: pretty bland and not a lot of seating for more than 2 people at a time. I got miso soup ($2.50) for a pretty large bowl. They definitely didn't skimp on tofu, but there was no seaweed in it. I really missed that! 

Crunch Roll was delicious. It had great presentation and lots of avocado. Usually there's a tiny sliver inside, but they didn't skimp on anything in the roll. It was $10.95 tho!! That's a lot for a small casual joint. My husband doesn't like sushi so he was going to get the chicken teriyaki, but when he saw the prices, he went next door for tacos instead. I will try it again but probably just for a take out roll.

Decided to support our Southern Highlands newcomer...Food was not awful guys...maybe on the bland side, but that's way better than overly seasoned. My wife went in to get the food to go, but I can see what the other reviewers were saying about the spartan decor. Owners: take 5 minutes to put a little love to design. And how hard is it to put some tunes...it'll help you guys when you're working as well. 

Then I saw the bill. Listen, Southern Highlands is considered a remote neighborhood. Places like Off The Strip set the standard for pricing and I remember an Italian restaurant that tried to match their pricing except for one big difference--Off The Strip gets it and they didn't. SOOO, they went out of business. Owners: it's a cautionary tale that you have to take seriously. You can't charge super pricing for this type of food. I know I know, you already got your flyers printed....but guys, that's cheap to replace. You also have a digital menu...changing that is easy. Wouldn't you rather lower the prices and get more people in than trying to get rich off a few? 

I believe in you guys, come on, I'm rooting for you--improve decor, food quality, and pricing and Southern Highlands will come.
This place is amazing, I've been twice and they have only been open 2 days.  Had to create their yelp page so I could let everyone know.
All the ambiance of a dmv with none of the character. Teriyaki chicken was weak, no brown rice option, and over priced, and the cook prepared at the speed of smell. Good luck!
